titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Abbot Augustus Low certificate of life membership to the Long Island Historical Society 1977.509
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:41:45 +0000.

did.unittitle: Abbot Augustus Low certificate of life membership to the Long Island Historical Society
did.abstract: The collection consists of a life membership certificate issued to Abbot Augustus Low by the Long Island Historical Society on March 9, 1875. Abbot Augustus Low (1843-1912) was the son of prominent Brooklyn businessman Abiel Abbot Low (1811-1893) and the nephew of Brooklyn Mayor Seth Low (1850-1916).

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Abbot Augustus Low (1843-1912) was the son of prominent Brooklyn businessman Abiel Abbot Low (1811-1893) and the nephew of Brooklyn Mayor Seth Low (1850-1916).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Abbot Augustus Low certificate of life membership to the Long Island Historical Society, 1977.509, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a life membership certificate issued to Abbot Augustus Low by the Long Island Historical Society on March 9, 1875.
